page.title: 06THE RECTORY & COACH HOUSE
page.content:
The Rectory was built in 1846. Before that, the Rectory used to be at 5, Glebelands, opposite the church. The last Rector to live in the Rectory, until 1971, was Rev. Garlick. Before the school was opened an earlier Rector, Rev. Redford, used to teach children in the Rectory.
The Coach House was once a part of the Rectory's drive. There is a saying that at night a carriage with six white horses goes up and down the drive once. A man steps out and walks through a wall where it is believed that a door used to be. The coach then just disappears into thin air.
The people who now live in the Coach House have heard footsteps like children's going up and down stairs.
